description: Conversion and extension of building to provide restaurant on ground and part of basement and 5 self-contained flats.  Construction of 4 storey side extension and ground floor rear conservatory, canopy/ramp to front, with bin stores, new access and parking at rear of the premises (Revised Application)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B24, ES6, H26, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 4.8, 5.5. | Notwithstanding the information contained in the application details of the design of the elevations of the approved four storey side extension and rear conservatory and details of the front canopy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  REASON:  To ensure that the appearance of the development harmonises with the existing building and the surrounding area which is a designated conservation area.  This is in accordance with the Unitary Development Plans policies B1, B24, ES6, and replacement (UDP) policies 4.1 and 4.8. | Details of suitable and sufficient acoustic separation between the floors and walls of the restaurant and flats shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the occupation of the development and the approved details shall be retained for the life of the building.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of the occupiers of the approved flats in accordance with the Unitary Development Plans policies B5, B8, ES5, H26 and replacement (UDP) policies 4.1, 4.11 and 5.5. | Notwithstanding the information contained in the application, details of the fume extraction ducting to the restaurant shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details which shall be retained for the life of the building.  REASON: To ensure that the equipment works satisfactorily in the interest to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the approved flats.  This is in accordance with the Unitary Development Plans policy B5, and replacement (UDP) policy 4.1. | Details shall be submitted of any machinery audible outside the premises shall be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding NR35 Leq,5min  for plant which will operate during the period of 2300-0700 hrs weekdays and anytime on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays. NR40 Leq, 1 hour  for plant which is controlled by time switches only to run during the period 0700-2300hrs Mondays to Fridays, measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises with all machines running together.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of the occupiers of the flats in accordance with the Unitary Development Plans policies B5, B8, ES5, H26 and replacement (UDP) policies 4.1, 4.11 and 5.5. | The approved A3 use shall only be used as a restaurant and shall be used for no other purpose including take away, wine bar, public bar, within Class A3 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 without the prior written permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:  To restrict the use to one compatible with the approved development and surrounding area, and to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, in the interests of the living conditions to neighbouring residents.  This is in accordance with the Unitary Development Plans policies B5, B8, ES5, H26, S18, and replacement (UDP) policies 4.1, 4.11, 5.5, and 7.6. | The hours of operation for the approved restaurant shall be 8am to 10pm only.  REASON: In the interests of the living conditions to neighbouring residents. This is in accordance with the Unitary Development Plans policies B5, H26, and replacement (UDP) policies 4.1, 5.5, and 7.6. | No amplified sound or other music shall be played at the approved restaurant premises.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions to the residents of the approved flats.  This is in accordance with the Unitary Development Plans policies B5, B8, ES5, H26, and replacement (UDP) policies 4.1, 4.11, 5.5, and 7.6. | The car parking space(s) shown on the approved plan No.846/2b received 29/01/2004 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking  within the site, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies T62, T63, Replacement UDP Policies 9.1, 9.11. | Details of both hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development.  Any tree or plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced.  REASON:  To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area.  This is in accordance with the Unitary Development Plans adopted policies B2, H26, and UDP replacement policies 4.1 and 5.5.
